metadata.feature_description: Configure and manage content approval workflows with multiple states and permissions

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Workflow in the Persona Bar
steps.expected: Workflows management page should display with list of existing workflows
steps.actual: Workflows page displayed with Create New Workflow button and list of system workflows (Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval)

steps.expected: New workflow form should appear with name and description fields
steps.actual: New workflow form appeared with Workflow Name and Description fields pre-populated with default 'NewWorkflow'

steps.action: Entered 'Test Workflow' as name and description, clicked Save
steps.expected: New workflow should be created and appear in the list
steps.actual: Test Workflow was created successfully and appeared in the workflow list with default states (Draft, Published)

steps.action: Clicked on Test Workflow to expand it and view workflow states
steps.expected: Workflow should expand showing current states and Add a State button
steps.actual: Test Workflow expanded showing states table with Draft and Published states, and an enabled 'Add a State' button

steps.expected: New state dialog should appear with name field and permissions options
steps.actual: Workflow State New dialog appeared with State Name field, Reviewers section with role permissions, and notification options

steps.action: Entered 'Review Pending' as state name and clicked Accept
steps.expected: New state should be added to the workflow
steps.actual: State 'Review Pending' was successfully added as Order 2 in the workflow states list

steps.action: Observed the Add State dialog permissions section
steps.actual: Dialog showed Reviewers section with Filter By Group dropdown, Select Role dropdown, and roles table with Review permissions checkboxes for Administrators, All Users, Content Editors, Content Managers, and Registered Users

steps.action: Clicked Edit (E) button on the Awaiting Review state
steps.expected: Edit state dialog should appear showing current permissions
steps.actual: Workflow State Edit dialog appeared showing the state name, reviewers configuration with Content Managers having Review permission, and notification options

steps.action: Opened edit dialog for Review Pending state
steps.expected: Should be able to modify state name and permissions
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened with editable State Name field and permissions grid

steps.action: Changed state name from 'Review Pending' to 'Awaiting Review' and clicked Accept
steps.expected: State name should be updated in the workflow
steps.actual: State name was successfully updated to 'Awaiting Review' in the workflow states table

steps.action: Clicked Delete (X) button on the Awaiting Review state
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared with message 'Are you sure you want to delete the Awaiting Review State?' with No and Yes buttons

steps.expected: State should be removed from workflow and remaining states reordered
steps.actual: Awaiting Review state was deleted successfully. Workflow now shows only Draft (Order 1) and Published (Order 2)

steps.action: Viewed workflow list showing DEFAULT column
steps.expected: Should show radio buttons for selecting default workflow
steps.actual: Workflow list displayed with DEFAULT column showing radio buttons for each workflow. Direct Publish was selected as default (filled radio button)

steps.action: Observed system workflows (Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval)
steps.expected: System workflows should have restricted editing capabilities
steps.actual: System workflows have disabled 'Add a State' buttons, and their first/last states cannot be deleted as indicated by the message 'The first and last workflow states of a workflow cannot be deleted'

observations: The workflow management UI is integrated into the Evoq Persona Bar under Settings > Workflow
System workflows (Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval) are protected and cannot have states added or their first/last states deleted
Custom workflows can be created with full state management capabilities including add, edit, and delete
State permissions allow configuring which roles can review content in each workflow state
Notification settings are available for both author/reviewers and administrators at the state level
The 'Assign workflow to module' functionality was not directly tested from this page - it appears to be configured at the page/module level settings rather than the workflow management page
